title: activity
description: An activity construct specifies all the details about an event that occurred in the past. The current focus is on knowledge sharing and social broadcasting.

object.description: Identifies the primary object of the activity. Example: A photo

target.description: Represents the object to which the activity was performed. Example: A photo album

postedTime.description: Time at which the activity occurred

generator.description: Represents the application which created the activity, which may be separate from the service to which the activity is published. For example, a third-party application on a mobile phone may be used to post a photo to a photo sharing service.

provider.description: Represents the service which is publishing the activity

title.description: An HTML representation of the natural language title for this activity. Consumers MAY use the value of this field, if set, as a fallback for when none of the provided verbs are recognized

body.description: An HTML representation of a natural language describing this activity including visual elements such as thumbnails. Consumers MAY use the value of this field, if set, as a fallback for when none of the provided verbs are recognized

links.description: Links between an this object and other resources as defined in Web Linking
links.note: Tell JSON schema team to not put links inside http://json-schema.org/hyper-schema.properties
